info.title: Event Portal - Designer
info.description:
REST API Concepts

Solace PubSub+ Event Portal provides REST APIs that you can use to manage your data in PubSub+ Cloud. 
The REST APIs allow you to model your event-driven architectures from your own client applications.

The following document describes the public REST APIs available for use in Event Portal 2.0. Objects created in this 
version will not be available in Event Portal 1.0. APIs that display (Beta) in their summary are provided as-is and 
are subject to change or removal. They may not be of the quality expected for generally available APIs and have no 
guaranteed forward compatibility with the generally available version of the API.

servers.description: Solace PubSub+ Cloud US EAST Region

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of enumerations based on certain criteria.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of enumerations to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the enumerations.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The application domain ID of the enumerations.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only enumerations in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: The names of the enumerations.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared enumerations.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of enumerations and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
An enumeration is a bounded variable with a limited set of literal values. Use this API to create an enumeration to define acceptable values for a level in a topic address or topic domain.

Token Permissions: [ `ep_enum:create:*` ]

201.description: Created an enumeration. The newly saved enumeration is returned in the response body.

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of events that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of events to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared events.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only events in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only events with the given IDs separated by commas.

200.description: Get a list of events and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
Events are the primary building block of an event-driven architecture. Applications publish and subscribe to events and events reference schemas. In the Event Portal, an event is a type of event as opposed to a specific event instance.

Token Permissions: [ `event:create:*` ]

requestBody.description: The event requires a name and an application domain ID.

201.description: Created an event. The newly saved event is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get a list of lifecycle states
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of lifecycle states that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

200.description: Get a list of lifecycle states and the accompanying metadata.

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of schemas that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of schemas to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the schema to match on.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared schemas.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only schemas in the given application domain.

parameters.name: schemaType
parameters.description: Match only schemas with the given schema type

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only schemas in the given application domain ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only schemas with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of schemas and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
To model your event-driven architecture, schemas are a fundamental building block for modelling the payloads of the events flowing through your system. Use this API to create schemas that can later be referenced by events.

Token Permissions: [ `schema:create:*` ]

requestBody.description: The schema requires a name, an application domain, a schema type and a content type.

201.description: Created a schema. The newly saved schema is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get a list of event APIs
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of event APIs that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the event API to match on.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only event APIs with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only event APIs in the given application domain.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only event APIs in the given application domains.

parameters.name: eventApiVersionIds
parameters.description: Match only event APIs in the given event API version ids.

parameters.name: availableWithinApplicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Additionally match any shared event APIs in any application domain.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match only with shared or unshared event APIs.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Match only event APIs with the given broker type.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of event APIs and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
Use this API to create an event API.

Token Permissions: [ `event_api:create:*` ]

201.description: Created an event API. The newly saved event API is returned in the response body.

Token Permissions: [ `application:update:*` ]

get.description:
Use this API to get a single enumeration by its ID.

Token Permissions: [ `ep_enum:get:*` ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

200.description: The enumeration.

delete.description:
Use this API to delete an enumeration. The enumeration must not have any versions or else it cannot be deleted.

Token Permissions: [ `ep_enum:delete:*` ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

204.description: No content is returned if the delete was successful.

404.description: If the enumeration did not exist.

patch.description:
Use this API to update an enumeration object. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

Token Permissions: [ `ep_enum:update:*` ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the enumeration.

200.description: Updated an enumeration. The newly saved enumeration is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get a list of the topic domains
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of topic domains that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of topic domains to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only topic domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: brokerType
parameters.description: Match only topic domains with the given brokerType.

parameters.name: applicationDomainIds
parameters.description: Match only topic domains with the given application domain ids separated by commas.

200.description: Get a list of topic domains and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
Topic Domains govern the format of topic addresses within an application domain

Token Permissions: [ `topic_domain:create:*` ]

201.description: Created a topic domain. Returns the newly saved topic domain in the response body.

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of applications that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of applications to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the application to match on.

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only applications in the given application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

parameters.name: applicationType
parameters.description: Match only applications with the given applicationType.

200.description: Get a list of applications and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
To model your event-driven architecture, applications are a fundamental building block for modelling the producers and consumers of events. Use this API to create applications and model the events they produce and consume.

Token Permissions: [ `application:create:*` ]

requestBody.description: Applications have a name and live within an application domain. Events can be added to the application as produced or consumed.

201.description: Created an application. Returns the newly saved application in the response body.

get.description:
Use this API to get a single schema by its ID.

Token Permissions: [ `schema:get:*` ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema.

200.description: The schema.

delete.description:
Use this API to delete a schema. The schema must not be in use by any events else it cannot be deleted.

Token Permissions: [ `schema:delete:*` ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema.

patch.description:
Update a schema.

Token Permissions: [ `schema:update:*` ]

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the schema.

requestBody.description: The schema requires a name, an application domain, a schema type and a content type.

200.description: Updated a schema. The newly saved schema is returned in the response body.

get.description:
Use this API to get a list of configurations that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: configurationTypeIds
parameters.description:
Match only configurations with the given configuration type IDs separated by commas.
Refer here for details on configuration types.

parameters.name: entityTypes
parameters.description: Match only configurations with the given entity type values separated by commas.

parameters.name: entityIds
parameters.description: Match only configurations with the given entity IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort based on the provided parameters.
The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

200.description: Get a list of configurations and the accompanying metadata.

get.summary: Get a list of event API versions
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of event API versions that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results to return in one page of results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get results from based on the page size.

parameters.name: eventApiIds
parameters.description: Match only event API versions of these event API IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match event API versions with the given IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of additional entities to include in the response.

parameters.name: stateId
parameters.description: Match event API versions with the given state ID.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of event API versions.

post.description:
Use this API to create an event API version.

Token Permissions: [ `event_api:update:*` ]

201.description: Created an event API version. Returns the newly saved event API version in the response body.

The value can be either a standalone field name (`?sort=`) or a field and direction, delimited by a colon (`?sort=:`). If the direction is not specified, the default is ascending.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: The list of Event API Products and the accompanying metadata.

201.description: Created an Event API Product. The newly saved Event API Product is returned in the response body.

get.summary: Get a list of the application domains
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of application domains that match the given parameters.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of application domains to get per page.

parameters.description: The page number to get.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to be used to match the application domain.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match only application domains with the given IDs separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Specify extra data to be included, options are: stats

200.description: Get a list of application domains and the accompanying metadata.

To help keep your event-driven architecture organized, use application domains to create namespaces for your applications, events and schemas.

201.description: Created. The newly saved application domain is returned in the response body.

get.summary: (Beta) Get a list of Event API Product versions
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of Event API Product versions that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `event_designer:access` ]

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of results to return in one page of results.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get results from based on the page size.

parameters.name: eventApiProductIds
parameters.description: Match only Event API Product versions of these Event API Product IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Match Event API Product versions with the given IDs, separated by commas.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of additional entities to include in the response.

parameters.name: stateId
parameters.description: Match Event API Product versions with the given state ID.

parameters.name: messagingServiceId
parameters.description: Match Event API Product versions with the given messagingServiceId.

parameters.name: clientAppId
parameters.description: Match Event API Product versions with the given clientAppId.

parameters.name: shared
parameters.description: Match Event API Product versions with the parent objects shared setting.

parameters.name: latest
parameters.description: Only return the latest version of Event API Products.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of Event API Product versions.

post.summary: (Beta) Create an Event API Product version
post.description:
Use this API to create an Event API Product version.

Token Permissions: [ `event_api_product:update:*` ]

201.description: Created an Event API Product version. Returns the newly saved Event API Product version in the response body.

parameters.name: customAttributes
parameters.description:
Returns the entities that match the custom attribute filter.
To filter by custom attribute name and value, use the format: `customAttributes===`.
To filter by custom attribute name, use the format: `customAttributes=`.
The filter supports the `AND` operator for multiple custom attribute definitions (not multiple values for a given definition). Use `;` (`semicolon`) to separate multiple queries with `AND` operation.
Note: the filter supports custom attribute values containing only the characters `[a-zA-Z0-9_\-\. ]`.

200.description: Get a list of enumeration versions and the accompanying metadata.

post.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Create an enumeration version.

requestBody.description: Enumeration version description with its values.

201.description: Created an enumeration version and its values. The newly saved enumeration version is returned in the response body.

parameters.description: The ID of the Event API Product version

patch.summary: Update an Event API Product version
patch.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to update an Event API Product version. You only need to specify the fields that need to be updated.

parameters.name: eventApiProductId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent Event API Product.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Event API Product version to update.

200.description: The updated Event API Product version.

get.summary: Get the AsyncAPI specification for an application version
get.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to get the AsyncAPI specification for an application version using the parent ID and the version's ID.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent application.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the application version.

parameters.name: showVersioning
parameters.description: Include versions in each AsyncAPI object's name when only one version is present

parameters.name: includedExtensions
parameters.description: The event portal database keys to include for each AsyncAPI object.

parameters.name: asyncApiVersion
parameters.description: The version of AsyncAPI to use

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format in which to get the AsyncAPI specification. Possible values are yaml and json.

parameters.name: messagingServiceId
parameters.description: Applies bindings from consumed events that are published in this messaging service's modeled event mesh.

200.description: The AsyncAPI specification for the application version.

patch.summary: Update the state of an Event API Product version
patch.description:
*Deprecation Date: 2022-11-01
Removal Date: 2023-12-01
Reason: Replaced by another endpoint.

*Use this API to update the state of an Event API Product version. You only need to specify the state ID field with the desired state ID.

parameters.name: eventApiProductId
parameters.description: The ID of the parent Event API Product.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Event API Product version to update.

200.description: The updated state of the Event API Product version.

post.summary: (Beta) Create an association between a gateway messaging service and an Event API Product version
post.description:
Use this API to associate an Event API Product version and gateway messaging service.

Token Permissions: [ `event_api_product:update:*` ]

parameters.name: eventApiProductVersionId
parameters.description: The ID of the Event API Product version to associate.

requestBody.description: Gateway messaging service Id and supported Protocols

200.description: Associated GatewayMessagingService to Event API Product version.

get.summary: Get a list the custom attribute definitions of provided application domain
get.description:
Use this API to get a list of custom attribute definitions that match the given parameters.

Token Permissions: [ `custom_attribute:get:*` ]

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: Match only custom attribute definitions with the given application domain Id

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of custom attribute definitions to get per page.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to get.

200.description: Get a list of custom attribute definitions of a given application domain id.

post.summary: Create a custom attribute definition for provided application domain
post.description:
Use this API to create a custom attribute definition for provided application domain.

Token Permissions: [ `custom_attribute:create:*` ]

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain

201.description: Created a custom attribute definition in provided application domain and Returns the newly saved custom attribute definition in the response body.

delete.summary: Delete a custom attribute definition of provided application domain
delete.description:
Use this API to delete a custom attribute definition by given application domain.

Token Permissions: [ `custom_attribute:delete:*` ]

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain

delete.summary: (Beta) Delete an association between a gateway messaging service and an Event API Product version
delete.description:
Use this API to disassociate an Event API Product version and gateway messaging service.

Token Permissions: [ `event_api_product:update:*` ]

parameters.name: eventApiProductVersionId
parameters.description: The ID of the Event API Product version to disassociate.

parameters.name: memAssociationId
parameters.description: The MEM association ID to dissociate from.

delete.summary: Delete a custom attribute definition of provided application domain
delete.description:
Use this API to delete a custom attribute definition of given application domain.

Token Permissions: [ `custom_attribute:delete:*` ]

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain

parameters.name: customAttributeId
parameters.description: The ID of the custom attribute definition

patch.summary: Update a custom attribute definition for provided application domain
patch.description:
Use this API to update a custom attribute definition for provided application domain.

Token Permissions: [ `custom_attribute:update:*` ]

parameters.name: applicationDomainId
parameters.description: The ID of the application domain

parameters.name: customAttributeId
parameters.description: The ID of the custom attribute definition

201.description: Updated a custom attribute definition in provided application domain and Returns the newly saved custom attribute definition in the response body.

description.example: Schema created by Solace PubSub+ Cloud API documentation

content.example: { "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema#", "$id": "http://example.com/root.json","type": "object", "title": "An example schema", "required": [ "attribute", ], "properties": { "attribute": { "$id": "#/properties/attribute", "type": "string", "title": "An example of a string based attribute", "examples": [ "aValue" ], "pattern": "^(.*)$" } }}

messageDeliveryMode.description: The mode that will be used for message delivery (ex: `guaranteed` uses a queue)

maximumTimeToLive.description: Duration in seconds of how long a message can live in a queue

queueType.description: The arrangement of queues on a broker used for message delivery (ex: `single` uses one queue per event API version in this event API product)

maxMsgSpoolUsage.description: Total number of MBs available for the queue to use
